intro: Hymenodictyon embergeri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Hymenodictyon embergeri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and woodland areas.
